meanings.sent1: She had to refold the paper to make it fit in the envelope.
meanings.sent2: I always refold my clothes after doing laundry to keep them organized.
meanings.sent3: Trying to refold a map in a hurry can lead to a tangled mess!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a letter that had been refolded too many times, creased and worn.
meanings.sent5: The origami master could refold a crane with his eyes closed, each fold precise and deliberate.

meanings.sent1: He had to refold the letter to fit it back into the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The old map had been refolded so many times that it was starting to tear at the creases.
meanings.sent3: She tried to refold the stubborn fabric, but it kept unfolding on its own!
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day would always refold themselves in his mind, never quite settling.
meanings.sent5: The secret letter was carefully refolded and hidden away, its contents known only to a few.
